entry.title: Gallery: Greta Constantine -- Toronto Fashion Week Fall 2012

link.Abstract: Though they made us wait two hours to see their collection, Greta Constantine designers Kirk Pickersgill and Stephen Wong delighted with a slight shift from their earlier jersey gowns. A palette of emerald green, indigo blue, white and smoky grey complimented futuristic feminine silhouettes with latticework necklines and low-cut posteriors to create a completely wearable and desireable collection. Congratulations to the Greta Constantine design duo, Fall 2012 was most certainly a success.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Greta Constantine designers Kirk Pickersgill and Stephen Wong at the end of their Fall 2012 presentation.
link.title: Greta Constantine -- Toronto Fashion Week Fall 2012

link.Abstract: Celebrities took the runway Thursday night for the Heart Truth fashion show in Toronto.
link.title: Photos: The 2012 Heart Truth Fashion Show

link.Abstract: Mega-model Heather Marks and 'Zombie Boy' competed with Mackage's cool-kid coats for buzzworthy-ness on the runway - the Canadian fashion brand's leather pants, jackets, and oversized neck wear naturally came out on top.
link.title: Photos: Mackage -- Toronto Fashion Week Fall 2012

entry.content: Though they made us wait two hours to see their collection, Greta Constantine designers Kirk Pickersgill and Stephen Wong delighted with a slight shift from their earlier jersey gowns. A palette of emerald green, indigo blue, white and smoky grey complimented futuristic feminine silhouettes with latticework necklines and low-cut posteriors to create a completely wearable and desireable collection. Congratulations to the Greta Constantine design duo, Fall 2012 was most certainly a success.

link.Abstract: Check out the stars that stopped by Paris Fashion Week.

link.Abstract: Karlie Kloss walks in the Kanye West runway show? Huh. Also, Kanye continues to design for Amber Rose despite her committment to new love interest, Wiz Khalifa.
link.title: Gallery: Kanye West -- Paris Fashion Week Fall 2012

link.Abstract: Karl Lagerfeld, head designer and creative director for Chanel, presented a Fall 2012 collection in signature Chanel textiles tweed and wool on models with glittering eyebrows. Check out photos from the runway.

entry.title: Gallery: People-Watching Outside Dior

link.Abstract: Mila Kunis! Olivia Palermo! Theadora Richards! Here, a collection of the people who came, saw, and wore something fabulous to Dior.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Olivia Palermo, Tali Lennox, Mila Kunis!
link.title: People-watching outside Dior

link.Abstract: Stella McCartney's Ready-to-Wear Collection features sporty stilettos, super tight buns, sapphire blue eyelids, and salmon pink knits...plus plenty more.
link.title: Gallery: Stella McCartney -- Paris Fashion Week Fall 2012

link.Abstract: Alber Elbaz presented his Fall 2012 collection for Lanvin as part of Paris Fashion Week. Aqua, violet, canary yellow and tangerine dresses made their way down the runway, with sculptural flounces adorning necks, backs and waists.
link.title: Photos: Lanvin -- Paris Fashion Week Fall 2012

entry.content: Mila Kunis! Olivia Palermo! Theadora Richards! Here, a collection of the people who came, saw, and wore something fabulous to Dior.

entry.title: Celebrity Makeup Mishaps

link.Abstract: We're used to stars looking glamorous and perfect, but sometimes it just doesn't happen. Check out some classic makeup mistakes made by the rich and famous.

link.Abstract: Lil Kim was a hot mess at the BET's Rip the Runway 2012. Where to start? The painted eyebrows? The overly done pout? The spider-y eyelashes? This is just too much to handle!

link.Abstract: Fashion models in the United States launched a rights group ahead of New York Fashion Week to seek workplace standards including backstage privacy to stop unauthorized nude photos and a program to provide confidential advice on dealing with sexual harassment.
link.title: Models form rights group ahead of New York Fashion Week

link.Abstract: Navy is likely to replace black on the catwalk when New York Fashion Week starts on February 9, with experts expecting rich fabrics, waist-defining jackets and some 1920s-inspired styles sparked by movies like The Artist.
link.title: Navy likely new black at New York Fashion Week
